roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: We'll hear argument now in number oh one six seventy-nine, Gonzaga University and Rob- Roberta S League versus John Doe.
Mr. Roberts.
[Inaudible]

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Thank you, Mr. Chief Justice, may it please the Court: In nineteen seventy-four, when it en- enacted the Family Educational r- Rights and Privacy Act, Congress conditioned Federal funding for educational institutions on the institution not having a policy or practice of releasing student records without consent.
Congress did not phrase this condition in terms of individual rights.

It did not, for example, follow the model of title nine, enacted two years earlier and also dealing with educational institutions, and say something like, no student at a school receiving Federal funds shall have his records released without his consent.
Instead, Congress proceeded more indirectly.
It said that no funds shall be made available to any institution having a policy or practice of releasing student records without consent.
The statute is directed to the Secretary of Education.
He's the one who makes Federal funds available, not to the institution receiving the funds, and certainly not to the individual student.
This Court's cases establish that that is a distinction that makes a difference.
In Cannon, for example, the Court said there would be...

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: far less reason --
Mr. Roberts, isn't it...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: primarily a distinction that makes a difference in c- connection with whether there's an implied cause of action, rather than whether nineteen eighty-three authorized a cause of action?

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: In the implied right of action question there are two questions, did Congress intend to create a right, and did Congress intend to provide a judicial remedy? In the nineteen eighty-three context, there are two questions, did Congress intend to create a right, and did Congress intend to preclude resort to the nineteen eighty-three remedy, so that first question I think is the same under both categories of cases, and as the Court said in Cannon, if Congress phrases the statute as quo- quote, as a prohibition on the disbursement of public funds, there's far less reason to think that they intended a private remedy.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: This- The the statute does talk about rights of students and rights rights of parents.

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, of course, the word rights does not appear in the disclosure provision, subsection B, and in Pennhurst, where the Court was dealing with the developmentally disabled bill of rights, the Court explained that just because the statute uses the word rights doesn't mean that it creates a nineteen eighty-three right.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Yes, I recognize in the one section that we're talking about here you have a stronger argument than the other, but if we a- assume for the moment would have a nineteen eighty-three cause of action under the whole act without going down provision by provision, then I I do think you have to recognize that w- the act does talk about rights of students, rights of parents t- to look at files, et cetera.

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, first of all, the Court in Blessing said that you don't look at the whole act.
eighty-two.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I think it's that latter rationale that might be stronger for your case.

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, whatever rights, whether you're talking e- putting aside the question whether it's a nineteen eighty-three right or a right to participate in the process that's established under the statute, it is part of the policy or practice that the Secretary of Education is to look to in deciding whether to disburse funds.
deal -- twelve...

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: twelve A of our statutory appendix, Your Honor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Thank you.

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: It says to the Secretary, you set up an office to investigate, process, review, and adjudicate complaints about violations under FERPA.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: You you say violations of this section.
There's no violation unless there's a policy.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: to investigate any individual complaint, un- unless the person comes in and says, not only do they do it to me, but this is their policy, right?

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: It's as evidence that there might be a problem with the school's policy, and this is what makes it different, for example, from the Wright case.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I guess that that's all that the plaintiff could a- could accomplish in court anyway.

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: That's correct.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: So the Secretary's enforcement authority is coextensive with what the court would be able to do.

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I- In terms of the scope of liabil-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: You'd need an allegation of a policy or practice.

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Exactly, but it is the fact that Congress focused on the policy or practice that helps establish that they were not concerned with individual instances of disclosure.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, Mr. Roberts, why are they mutually exclusive? I mean, the the Secretary has this authority, and I think your argument would be more impressive if this were a large operation.

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: It's it's very important to keep in mind the distinction behow- between how matters are handled before the Family Policy Compliance Office and in court.
Do we know -- do we know...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: from the maybe the attorn- Solicitor General can tell us if the seven people are overworked?

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: In fact, in practice most of what they do is field questions from the school, how do we handle this situation, what do we do...
about this?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: order? I mean tha- one of the points that was made is that if e- records are about to be divulged, say, to a newspaper, and the student or the parent wants an s- immediate stop order, you can go into court and get a TRO.

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, there certainly is.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: This office can't really give relief to any individual, however, right, except to tell the tell the school not to release wrongfully release records in the future, right?

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: The focus of the office is in vindicating what the statute provides.
So all -- all you have to...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: do is eliminate the policy, and everything that's happened in the past is water over the dam and...
Because the --

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: go and sin no more is what the Secretary says, right?

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Because the statute is directed to prospective compliance, not retrospective compensation for injuries.
The nineteen eighty-th- --

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: What do you do about the the language where it says, no funds shall be made available to a school that effectively prevents, et cetera, th- the students th- ri- giv- it says, of the right to inspect.

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: The direct response is that you've left out words in the quote, which is that no funds shall be made available to an institution that has a policy or practice, and the question is, is Congress focusing on protecting individual rights in, as the Court said in Blessing, an individual way, or are they addressing a systemic concern.
Subsection B does not talk about rights.
And finally, I'll --  th- the answer  --

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: b- be sure I've understand your answer.

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I think not,
because --

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: The the right to inspect is not an independent and freestanding right.
Subsection B --

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: initial submission is that this is not a rights-creating statute, it just er- addre- but but I don't know where the right comes from that they refer to in that section and also in...
-- in on twelve A informing...

text_blocks.text: parents and students of rights under this section.

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Under this section.

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

action.

text_blocks.text: Ms. Millett, we'll hear from you.

Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court: If I could begin by responding to Justice Kennedy's question about whether the Family Policy Compliance Office is overworked, I will tell you that they do work very hard, but they do they handle for a small staff, they handle an amazing amount of work, and have been doing so for twenty-eight years under this statute.
as they go through the investigation stages.
Hmm?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: That's three letters a day.
Yes, but they also I'm I'm not done with my list if you'll forgive me.
That's ten phone calls a day.

That's right and well and well over a well over a thousand e-mails, and I think one of the reasons that there isn't I mean, if you look at the the legal landscape out there, too, there hasn't been an e- enormous volume of nineteen eighty-three actions, and that is because the Secretary has been very successful, I think, in communicating and enforcing this in an informal manner with the universities.
action...

fails, a statute that --

I think it's it's not for- I've two answers.
pre-existing moral or legal -- Mhm.

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Do you think the right to which the statute refers is a federally created right,
Mhm.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: or right with a different source?
I think what the st- the statute is creating there is a Federal overlay to protect pre- as as as was said in the legislative history on page seventeen...
of our brief,

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: So that if a school came back and said, in our State there's no such right,
then the statute would not apply?

Congress felt that when they said preexisting moral or legal rights, that ther- there was a sense of Congress that this is a type of, n- not not in a right sense that we use in for purposes of nineteen eighty-three actions, but con- the legislative history was that Congress had a sense here that this was something all individuals should have.
But -- this...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: i- It It is som- something they should have by reason of this statute, and therefore it's rightly created, or by reason of some preexisting rule of law in some at some other source?
Well, i- Congress' language was preexisting moral or legal, rights and so I'm I'm not sure what one considers...
If it's another source, it seems to me that...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States

doesn't matter, which you have --

text_blocks.text: nonexistent right, if I understand you...
Well, then thed- there's a fed there is there's no doubt that there's a Federal level of protection here for privacy, and it wa- it it's at a aggregated, collective system-wide level.
level of   --

I think it works generally, and then you look at the Blessing inquiry to see if Congress intended to create a right, they intended to create a right from all of those reasons I have said.

text_blocks.text: Mr. Roberts, you have four minutes remaining.

text_blocks.text: Thank you, Your Honor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: They're answerable to us, presumably.

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well It is implausible to suppose that the same Congress that was so worried about multiple interpretations of the law from the regional offices of one Department would have been perfectly content and, in fact, intended to confer the right for every one of sixty-two million students to go into court in a nineteen eighty-three action.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States

text_blocks.text: Thank you, Mr. Roberts.
Thank you, Your Honor.
